meanings.definition: To eat or snack, especially in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: After school, I like to fress on cookies and milk.
meanings.sent2: During the picnic, everyone fressed on sandwiches and chips.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he couldn't resist the urge to fress on the delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: The buffet table beckoned, inviting guests to fress like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread made it impossible not to fress until full.

meanings.definition: To indulge in eating or feasting.
meanings.sent1: During the holidays, we tend to fress on all the festive treats.
meanings.sent2: At the buffet, guests were encouraged to fress to their heart's content.
meanings.sent3: She decided to fress on ice cream for dinner, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The celebration was a chance for everyone to fress like royalty.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the grand feast made it hard not to fress until satisfied.

meanings.definition: To consume food with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: The kids always fress on pizza when it's movie night.
meanings.sent2: At the food festival, people fressed on all kinds of exotic dishes.
meanings.sent3: He would fress on popcorn while watching his favorite show.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the barbecue made everyone want to fress without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The bakery's display of pastries made it tempting to fress on everything in sight.
